0.body: These pages give instructions on how to use the applications of the SLAM SYSTEMS software suite. The suite consists of the following applications: Cloud , SLAM SYSTEMS cloud allows you to manage your Users and roles Licenses Products Sport Player delivers rock solid playback performance on macOS. Sport iPadOS app that can easily manage and remote control player. Try using the search function or browse the Help Topics to find the information you’re looking for.
0.title: Online Manual

1.body: Cloud is the online management tool for the SLAM SYSTEMS software suite. Please Note that an internet connection is required for cloud.slam.systems on each computer to activate your application. When you register for a new account you will get an email from noreply@slam.systems to verify your email address and add you to your Organization/Company. Click on the link provided to confirm your log in credentials. We will contact you according to your registration information as soon as possible, once confirmed, your account will be activated.
1.title: Cloud

10.body: Download the latest SLAM SYSTEMS software as well as versions for older operating systems here. You will also find help on how to set up your Player network or building Projects as well as templates for download.
10.title: Resources

11.body: Only the admin role of the organization can access this. Overview of all Users that have access to your Organization. Add User You can Add User if you are the initial administrator of the organization. Add User Click Create button after filling in the form.
11.title: Users

12.body: An overview of your cloud-based licenses including purchase and software maintenance information as well as assignment status. Only organization manager can access this page.
12.title: Licenses

13.body: An overview of the software products that are connected to your Organization. Each of product license including its product, version, license, last updated, status and name. Organization manager can reject , accept license requests in actions menu.
13.breadcrumbs: Cloud » Side Bar » Product Licenses » Product Licenses
13.title: Product Licenses

14.body: Only the Reseller Organization Admin role can access this. Overview of all Clients that under your Organization. Add Client You can Add Client by sending the invite link to your client.
14.title: Clients

15.body: Click more button then in the drop down menu, select PRODUCT LICENSES to Accept or Reject license for products. Client Product License Accept
15.breadcrumbs: Cloud » Side Bar » Clients » Manage Client Product Licenses
15.title: Manage Client Product Licenses

16.body: Guideline for Sport Player in Mac devices.
16.title: Sport Player

18.body: The interface of Cloud Licensing . Active Enter your email : same as login account of https://cloud.slam.systems SLAM key : https://cloud.slam.systems Active wait You can click "Refresh in xx seconds..." once organization's manager has ACCEPT this license to this player. Active approved
18.breadcrumbs: Sport Player » Cloud Licensing » Cloud Licensing Active
18.title: Cloud Licensing Active

19.body: On the Menu, Help --> Playlist Template Template
19.breadcrumbs: Sport Player » Playlist Template » Playlist Template
19.title: Playlist Template

2.body: Please go to https://cloud.slam.systems/register , read the FIRST STEP carefully then contact us. Organization accounts can add by Organization manager directly.
2.title: Register

20.body: Config Host Name Default is machine name, you can change it want you want. Player Role . select role of player, if select Main that means you to select clip folder,if select backup means clip must synchronize from Main Player. Select Folder... . choose your folder contain clips and playlist(csv file) Refresh . Validate destination content in folder, if valid, a green mark icon prompt, otherwise red color tips prompt. For more detail of error using Diagnosis to correct your playlist content. Show in Finder . Popup finder of clip folder. Lists of error occur Err1 Err2 Err3 Err4 Err5 Err6 Err7
20.title: Configuration

21.body: StarPlayer Once your destination folder selected,the Player will validate the content of folder.
21.breadcrumbs: Sport Player » Start Play » Start Play
21.title: Start Play

22.body: When player is enter fullscreen, press ESC will restore window's size to normal, otherwise nothing be change.
22.breadcrumbs: Sport Player » Quit Play » Quite Play
22.title: Quite Play

23.body: Tips When something invalid in playlist, use this function to find out what exactly wrong in playlist, because sometime maybe more than one error in playlist, then correct the content in origin playlist(.numbers or .xlsx file) and export to csv format again to replace invalid csv file. Entrance Select Menu 'Help'->Diagnosis Screenshot Screenshot Screenshot Screenshot Screenshot Upper part is about system and some hardware information, such information can be feedback to us after the problem occurs to isolate the problem. ![Error](DG-Error.jpg) Error Error Error Lower part is playlist preview, when playlist is valid, content is similar to orange color, otherwise there is red color text of red color border to isolate at exactly field. Here is list reason of invalid content: 'Clip' filed is empty, red border will be around. 'Sponsor / Clip: Main Partner' is empty, red border will be around. 'Clip /Name' field is empty, red border will be around. 'Clip /Name' field is filled, but clip file is not exist in folder there will be a red text. 'Clip /Name' field is filled, but clip is not compatible with PLAYER( currently only support QuickTime Format .mov .mp4, m4v ) there will be a red text. 'ClipTime' field is empty, red border will be around. Notice: 'Sponsor / Clip: Local Partner' and 1-8 field can be empty.
23.title: Diagnosis

24.body: Quick Start guide for SLAMDECK LIVE ELS SPORT . Preview
24.title: Sport

25.body: To install Sport app on your iPadOS devices, Requires an iPad running at least iPadOS 15 and oboved. Using App Store to install. Search keyword "SLAM DECK LIVE" . Click dowload icon below. Scan app's QR code. Sport QR code
25.title: Installation

26.body: Login Page Login . Use SLAM SYSTEMS cloud account to login. FORGOT PASSWORD . Click the FORGOT PASSWORD and follow the instruction to reset your password. REMEMBER ME . Save your password to system keytrain for safety. Tips: Only the activate account could login. If you don't have an account, Please see 1.1 Register .
26.title: Login

27.body: The interface of Sport app and its annotation. Home Page Top Bar Status: show the status of RECEIVE DATA, MEDIA PLAYER and RUNNING PAGE. Audio Control: Current settings of Audio Control, click to popup its setting view. Time Display: Playing clip time or playlist time. Fade Control: Current settings of Fade Control, click to popup its setting view. Nova Controls: Including BRIGHTNESS and RGB BRIGHTNESS. Content Playlist: Playlist of connected players. Overview: Overview of one playlist. Preview: Preview of one playlist. Play Control: Player control, Previous, Next, Play and Pause. Bottom Bar C/P Time: Toogle button switch Time Display between clip Time and Playlist Time. P-SYNC: Player Sync, setup players connection and sync. SETTINGS: Setting Time Display counting and Sign Out.
27.title: Home

28.body: Including Status View, Time Display and function control views.
28.title: Top Bar

29.body: RECEIVE DATA : This will show NONE, SYNCHRONIZING, COMPLETE and error message. MEDIA PLAYER : Showing the connection status CONNECTED or DISCONNECT. RUNNING PAGE : Shows the current runnig page name.
29.breadcrumbs: Sport » Top Bar » Status View » Status View
29.title: Status View

3.body: Login with your Email and password. If you forgot your password, then click the forgot your password link below the password field. Please see 1.3 Forget password . if you don't have an account, click Register an account link to register. Please see 1.1 Register .
3.title: Login

30.body: Time Display format is HH:MM:SS. A progress bar of current clip or playlist below the Time, See C/P TIME button in Bottom Bar . To setting counting up/down time please see Settings .
30.breadcrumbs: Sport » Top Bar » Time Display » Time Display
30.title: Time Display

31.body: Audio Control on the Top Bar shows the current settings of audio, for display only. Audio Control To setup audio, tap on it to popup the setting view. Use the vertical slider to adjust the volumn. Press MUTE button to mute audio, at the same time, the text color change to orange.
31.breadcrumbs: Sport » Top Bar » Audio Control » Audio Control
31.title: Audio Control

32.body: Audio Control Fade Control on the Top Bar only shows the current settings of cross fade, to setup fade, tap on it to popup the setting view. Use the vertical slider to adjust the fade durations. Press GO TO BLACK button to black screen, at the same time, pause the player. Press RESET button to restore default settings.
32.breadcrumbs: Sport » Top Bar » Fade Control » Fade Control
32.title: Fade Control

33.body: Overview This is function can be work with models of *Novastar Controller in MCTRL 660 pro, MCTRL 4K. Make sure USB cable connected between *Novastar Controller and Mac, otherwise the Brightness control panel will be empty. Make sure LED screen is Power On and signal line(using Ethernet Line) is connect between *Novastar Controller and LED screen, otherwise the Brightness control panel will be empty. For more detail please contact support team.
33.title: Brightness

34.breadcrumbs: Sport » Top Bar » Brightness » * Novastar is a trademark belong Xi'an NovaStar Tech Co., Ltd.
34.title: * Novastar is a trademark belong Xi'an NovaStar Tech Co., Ltd.

35.body: Overview This is function can be work with models of *Novastar Controller in MCTRL 660 pro, MCTRL 4K. Make sure USB cable connected between *Novastar Controller and Mac, otherwise the Brightness control panel will be empty. Make sure LED screen is Power On and signal line(using Ethernet Line) is connect between *Novastar Controller and LED screen, otherwise the Brightness control panel will be empty. RESET value is Red:50 Green:50 Blue:50 For more detail please contact support team.
35.breadcrumbs: Sport » Top Bar » RGB Brightness » RGB Brightness
35.title: RGB Brightness

36.breadcrumbs: Sport » Top Bar » RGB Brightness » * Novastar is a trademark belong Xi'an NovaStar Tech Co., Ltd.
36.title: * Novastar is a trademark belong Xi'an NovaStar Tech Co., Ltd.

37.body: Page List, Overview of Page and Preview of Page.
37.title: Content

38.body: Playlist If connected to the players, the playlist will be listed here. If not connect yet, please go to P-SYNC . Click one of the playlist go to Overview page.
38.title: Playlist

39.body: If connected to the players, the clips of selected playlist will be listed here. Overview This layout and contents are same as the Number template. Curring playing clip will show with highlight color. The Playlist row shown on the top-right content page, click the playlist button to switch playlist. Click the OVERVIEW button will switch to PREVIEW page. If the player is not connected yet, please go to P-SYNC .
39.title: Overview

4.body: You can reset your password by your register Email. If the email is valid, you will receive an email to reset your password, click the link in the email to reset your password.
4.title: Forget Password

40.body: Each clip could has its presets, including GAMMA, CURRENT GAIN and RGB BRITHNESS. NOTE : Nova controller connect to the PLAYER machine by USB is NEEDED . PRESETS The PRESET button is on the bottom of OVERVIEW page, next to OVERVIEW button. To enable preset mode, just click the PRESET button, then a alert will be shown and confirm you need to enable the preset mode, in case click by mistake. NOTE : It is strongly recommended to enter PRESET mode only during debugging phase. PRESET MODE During preset mode, click on a clip to start configuring its preset. Each adjustment is saved immediately after the change. The selected clip will loop for easy debugging. If the clip has a preset, it will appear with magenta highlight border in the Overview list (only during the preset mode). PRESET LIST Click the EXIT PRESET button to exit PRESET mode.
40.title: Preset

41.body: List all overviews of current selected playlist. Preview Curring playing clip will show with highlight border. Click the PREVIEW button will switch to OVERVIEW page.
41.title: Preview

42.body: Control the player, including Previous, Next, Play and Pause. We have to connect the player and sync (See P-SYNC ) first to have these controls.
42.breadcrumbs: Sport » Content » Play Control » Play Control
42.title: Play Control

44.body: Playlist MUST contain overlay of OVERLAY list and it's content, otherwise, OVERLAY function can not works properly.
44.title: Noticement

46.body: PLAY OVERLAY Tap OVERLAY in playlist bar Step1 Tap thumbnail button to play overlay clip Step2 Overlay clip is cover in normal clip Step3 Cancel Overlay Tap the currently playing Overlay clip Step2 Overlay is remove from normal clip Step3
46.title: Demostration

47.body: App name, copyright and function buttons.
47.title: Bottom Bar

49.body: Playlist MUST contain teaser list and it's content, otherwise, teaser function can not works properly. The codec of teaser clip MUST using Apple ProRes 4444 and contain alpha channel, otherwise teaser function can not be apply or unpredictable result. Codec TEASER list must contain 2 clips, the player use the first clip as home team teaser and the second clip is guest team teaser content. Teaser TeaserHome TeaserHome2 TeaserGuest TeaserGuest2 Playlist MUST contain timeout list and it's content, otherwise only teaser content overlay in normal playlist content. Teaser Sample of timeout list Timeout
49.title: Noticement

5.body: In the top bar, logged-in user display on the top-right. Click user account will show a pop up menu including Account and Sign out.
5.title: Top Bar

51.body: Step1 Home team request timeout press home team button. Step2 home team teaser content is overlay in clip until countdown run to zero. Step3 Guest team request timeout Guest Home team button Step2 Guest teaser content is overlay on normal clip until countdown run to zero. Step3 Switch timeout clip Simply tap other thumbnail, when countdown run to zero, timeout will stop, you can not change it anymore. Cancel timeout by manually Just long press TIMEOUT button until blinking stop then teaser content and timeout content will disappear. Step3
51.title: Demostration

52.body: Players Sync Tap P-SYNC button; Check the circle box to select Players; Click SYNC button to start connection and synchornise. The PROCESS bar showing the sync progress, disappears after sync is complete.
52.title: P-SYNC

53.body: Setting Time Display counting and Sign Out. Count Up/Down for Playlist Time and Clip Time can be set separately. The USER section shows current login user information. Sign Out button will logout and back to Login Page .
53.title: Settings

54.body: Redundency of iPads Main purpose of iPad is control the PLAYER and show information from PLAYER. When the SPORT app quit or iPad shutdown, nothing influence to the PLAYER, PLAYER will keep stop or loop play current page of playlist automatically. When the SPORT quit or iPad reboot unexpectedly, reopen SPORT and press SYNC then select Main or Main/Backup player SPORT will show the latest information from Main PLYAER. Prepare second iPad( SPORT installed) for some emergency case (eg: iPad can't boot, overheat shutdown) is necessary.
54.title: Explaination

65.body: Overview This is function can be work with models of Novastar Controller in VX16s, MCTRL 660 pro, MCTRL 4K. Make sure USB cable connected between Controller and Mac. For more detail please contact Watermoon .

66.body: This feature may have to upgrade the player's version(Available since 2023.04). This feature available for specific models (eg: Nemezes 10AC) and make sure USB cable connected between MAC and NOVAStart controller. When hardware support, control panel will show in top right of SPORT.app ,otherwise is blank. Drag then rise up finger will apply to whole screen. If Synchronize is on, all the gain value is same as any slider you drag. RESET value is not a fix number,it depend on specific LED models. For more detail please contact Watermoon Inc. Panel Diff Synchronize

8.body: List the main navigation menus. Some menus only allow access to authorized roles. User menus: Dashboard Resources Reseller Organize Admin menus: Dashboard Resources Users Clients Client Organize Admin menus: Dashboard Resources Users Licenses Product Licenses

9.body: Provides a summarized overview of pending and registered SLAM SYSTEMS applications as well as latest information on SLAM SYSTEMS products and services. You can also confirm your account type here. Organization type: Reseller, Client User Type: User, Orgazation Admin
9.title: Dashboard
